page.title: 12Societies in Eglwysbach
page.content: Most of the village Societies meet during the winter months in the village hall. For younger boys there are Cubs whilst the older children meet for the Youth Club every Thursday night. Every Tuesday the Welsh League of Youth (Aelwyd) meet and their activities are conducted in Welsh. Wednesday afternoons and sometimes in the evenings the Darby and Joan group meet. The young wives meet once a month and many of them meet at school for a keep fit and netball practice. On Friday afternoons, monthly, the Mother's Union meet in the church. The Women's Institute also meet once a month whilst another group for Welsh-speaking women (Merched y Wawr) meet weekly.The chapels have a monthly Literary Society. Salt Club, an open Scripture Union Adventurers group for children aged 6 to 11, meets weekly.
